abstract: Federal prosecutors and SAC Capital Advisors are said to be in settlement talks. | Alibaba has shifted its initial public offering plans to New York from Hong Kong. | JPMorgan Chase is negotiating a multibillion-dollar settlement with state and federal agencies over its sale of troubled mortgage securities before the financial crisis.
snippet: Federal prosecutors and SAC Capital Advisors are said to be in settlement talks. | Alibaba has shifted its initial public offering plans to New York from Hong Kong. | JPMorgan Chase is negotiating a multibillion-dollar settlement with state and fe...
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have begun talks with the hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors to settle criminal insider trading charges against the firm, DealBook’s Peter Lattman reports. The settlement talks are at an early stage, and the two sides are far from any agreement, people briefed on the case said. The government is seeking a guilty plea from SAC and a financial penalty of as much as $2 billion, they said.
